sentenceEN: A site is a place that archaeologists want to excavate or explore.
sentenceES: Un sitio es un lugar que los arqueÃ³logos quieren excavar o explorar.
explanation: A site is the location where archaeological work takes place. Un sitio es el lugar donde se realiza el trabajo arqueolÃ³gico.

sentenceEN: Artifacts are objects found at the site. They are not living things. They were made by someone.
sentenceES: Los artefactos son objetos encontrados en el sitio. No son seres vivos. Fueron hechos por alguien.
explanation: Artifacts are human-made objects discovered by archaeologists. Los artefactos son objetos hechos por humanos descubiertos por arqueÃ³logos.

sentenceEN: A DNA test is a way to discover what is in the body's cells. It can help you find your relatives.
sentenceES: Una prueba de ADN es una forma de descubrir quÃ© hay en las cÃ©lulas del cuerpo. Puede ayudarte a encontrar a tus parientes.

sentenceEN: A CT Scan is a way to see inside a body. You can discover if a person has illnesses.
sentenceES: Una tomografÃ­a es una forma de ver dentro del cuerpo. Puedes descubrir si una persona tiene enfermedades.

sentenceEN: A sample is a small amount of something, such as food, that someone analyzes.
sentenceES: Una muestra es una pequeÃ±a cantidad de algo, como comida, que alguien analiza.
explanation: A sample is a small portion taken for testing or analysis. Una muestra es una pequeÃ±a porciÃ³n tomada para pruebas o anÃ¡lisis.

sentenceEN: To excavate means to uncover something by removing the soil that is covering it.
sentenceES: Excavar significa descubrir algo quitando la tierra que lo cubre.
explanation: To excavate is to dig up or uncover objects buried in the ground. Excavar es desenterrar o descubrir objetos enterrados en el suelo.

sentenceEN: To analyze means to study something closely and carefully.
sentenceES: Analizar significa estudiar algo de cerca y cuidadosamente.
explanation: To analyze means to examine something in detail to understand it better. Analizar significa examinar algo en detalle para entenderlo mejor.

sentenceEN: To bury means to put a dead person or animal in the ground.
sentenceES: Enterrar significa poner a una persona o animal muerto en el suelo.
explanation: To bury means to place a body in the earth or a tomb. Enterrar significa colocar un cuerpo en la tierra o una tumba.

sentenceEN: To die means to stop living.
sentenceES: Morir significa dejar de vivir.
explanation: To die means when a living being ceases to be alive. Morir significa cuando un ser vivo deja de estar vivo.

sentenceEN: To discover means to see or find something for the first time.
sentenceES: Descubrir significa ver o encontrar algo por primera vez.
explanation: To discover means to find or learn about something new. Descubrir significa encontrar o aprender sobre algo nuevo.

sentenceEN: Surfing is riding waves on a board in the ocean.
sentenceES: El surf es montar olas en una tabla en el ocÃ©ano.
explanation: Surfing is a water sport where you ride ocean waves on a surfboard. El surf es un deporte acuÃ¡tico donde montas olas del ocÃ©ano en una tabla de surf.

sentenceEN: Hang-gliding is flying through the air using a special glider.
sentenceES: El ala delta es volar por el aire usando un planeador especial.
explanation: Hang-gliding is an air sport where you fly using a lightweight glider. El ala delta es un deporte aÃ©reo donde vuelas usando un planeador ligero.

sentenceEN: Skiing is sliding down snowy mountains on skis.
sentenceES: El esquÃ­ es deslizarse por montaÃ±as nevadas en esquÃ­s.

sentenceES: El kitesurf combina el surf con volar una cometa grande.

sentenceEN: Skateboarding is performing tricks and riding on a skateboard.

sentenceEN: Motocross is racing motorcycles on rough outdoor tracks.
sentenceES: El motocross es carreras de motocicletas en pistas al aire libre con terreno irregular.
explanation: Motocross is an off-road motorcycle racing sport on rough terrain. El motocross es un deporte de carreras de motocicletas fuera de carretera en terreno irregular.

sentenceES: El snowboard es deslizarse por pendientes nevadas en una sola tabla.

sentenceEN: The Sphinx was built in Egypt a very long time ago.
sentenceES: La Esfinge fue construida en Egipto hace mucho tiempo.
explanation: Use 'was built' because The Sphinx is singular and the action happened in the past. Usa 'was built' porque la Esfinge es singular y la acciÃ³n ocurriÃ³ en el pasado.

sentenceEN: The people of Pompeii were buried under a volcano.
sentenceES: La gente de Pompeya fue enterrada bajo un volcÃ¡n.
explanation: Use 'were buried' because 'people' is plural and the action happened in the past. Usa 'were buried' porque 'gente' es plural y la acciÃ³n ocurriÃ³ en el pasado.

sentenceEN: Gold treasures were found in England.
sentenceES: Tesoros de oro fueron encontrados en Inglaterra.
explanation: Use 'were found' because 'treasures' is plural and the action happened in the past. Usa 'were found' porque 'tesoros' es plural y la acciÃ³n ocurriÃ³ en el pasado.

sentenceEN: The treasures weren't hidden in a tomb.
sentenceES: Los tesoros no estaban escondidos en una tumba.
explanation: Use 'weren't hidden' because 'treasures' is plural and we need the negative form. Usa 'weren't hidden' porque 'tesoros' es plural y necesitamos la forma negativa.

sentenceEN: Skiing has been part of the Olympics since 1936.
sentenceES: El esquÃ­ ha sido parte de las Olimpiadas desde 1936.
explanation: Use 'since' with specific points in time (1936). Use 'for' with periods of time. Usa 'since' con puntos especÃ­ficos en el tiempo (1936). Usa 'for' con perÃ­odos de tiempo.

sentenceEN: Since the 1930s, millions of people have tried skiing.
sentenceES: Desde los aÃ±os 30, millones de personas han probado el esquÃ­.

sentenceEN: Kitesurfing has been popular for twenty years.
sentenceES: El kitesurf ha sido popular durante veinte aÃ±os.
explanation: Use 'for' with periods of time (twenty years). Use 'since' with specific points in time. Usa 'for' con perÃ­odos de tiempo (veinte aÃ±os). Usa 'since' con puntos especÃ­ficos en el tiempo.

sentenceEN: Extreme skiing can be super dangerous.
sentenceES: El esquÃ­ extremo puede ser sÃºper peligroso.
explanation: Adverbs of emphasis (super, really, so) come before adjectives. Los adverbios de Ã©nfasis (super, really, so) vienen antes de los adjetivos.

sentenceEN: Our kayaking trip was so amazing.

explanation: The adverb 'so' comes before the adjective 'amazing'. El adverbio 'so' viene antes del adjetivo 'amazing'.

sentenceEN: The mountain bike riders are incredibly careful.
sentenceES: Los ciclistas de montaÃ±a son increÃ­blemente cuidadosos.

sentenceEN: Skiing is very fun on a sunny day.
sentenceES: El esquÃ­ es muy divertido en un dÃ­a soleado.
explanation: The adverb 'very' comes before the adjective 'fun'. El adverbio 'very' viene antes del adjetivo 'fun'.

sentenceEN: Skateboarding has been my favorite sport for six months.
sentenceES: La patineta ha sido mi deporte favorito durante seis meses.
